name: if
posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to say that a particular thing can or will happen only after something else happens or becomes true

example.eg: I'll pay you double if you get the work finished by Friday.
example.egtrans: 如果你周五前完工，我付你双倍的报酬。

example.eg: We'll have the party in the garden if the weather's good. If not (= if the weather is not good), it'll have to be inside.
example.egtrans: 如果天气好的话，我们将在花园里开派对。如果不好，就只好在室内了。

example.eg: If anyone calls, just say I'll be back in the office at four o'clock.
example.egtrans: 要是有人给我打电话，请告诉他们我4点钟回办公室。

example.eg: If she hadn't called, I wouldn't have known.
example.egtrans: 要不是她打来电话，我还不知道呢。

example.eg: I wouldn't work for them (even) if they paid me twice my current salary.
example.egtrans: 即使他们付给我的工资是现在的两倍，我也不会为他们干活。

example.eg: We'll deal with that problem if and when it arises.
example.egtrans: 等到那个问题出现我们再处理。

example.eg: If disturbed, the bird may abandon the nest, leaving the chicks to die.
example.egtrans: 如果受到惊扰，鸟可能会弃巢而去，留下雏鸟，任由它们死亡。

example.eg: They're great kids, even if they can be demanding.
example.egtrans: 虽然他们要求多多，但他们是很好的孩子。

example.eg: It was a hot, if windy day.
example.egtrans: 那天虽然有风，却依然很热。

example.eg: If water is heated to 100°C it turns to steam.
example.egtrans: 水被加热到100摄氏度时，就会变成蒸汽。

example.eg: If I don't get enough sleep I get a headache.
example.egtrans: 我睡眠不足时就会头疼。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to mean "if it is true that"

example.eg: I'm very sorry if I've offended you.
example.egtrans: 如果我冒犯了你的话，我很抱歉。

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to introduce a clause, often in indirect speech, that shows two or more possibilities
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于引出从句，常为间接引语）是否

example.eg: Mrs Kramer called half an hour ago to ask if her cake was ready.
example.egtrans: 克雷默夫人半小时前来电话问她的蛋糕做好了没有。

example.eg: I don't care if he likes it or not - I'm coming!
example.egtrans: 我不在乎他乐不乐意，我反正要来！

example.eg: I was wondering if you'd like to come to the cinema with me this evening?
example.egtrans: 不知你今晚想不想与我一起去看电影？

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you want to make a polite request or remark
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于礼貌地作出请求或评论）

example.eg: If you'd like to take a seat, Mr Chang will be with you in a moment.
example.egtrans: 您请先坐一会儿吧，张先生一会儿就过来。

example.eg: Would you mind if I open/opened (= can I open) the window?
There are, if you don't mind me saying so, one or two problems with this plan.
example.egtrans: 恕我冒昧，我觉得这个计划有一两处问题。

name: if
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is not certain or not yet decided
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不确定因素；未决之事；疑问

example.eg: There's a big if hanging over the project (= it is uncertain whether the project will happen).
example.egtrans: 这个计划能否启动仍然悬而未决。
